instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164A: What is 820-00164A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 4v
threads.message: so this machine came with clean board, measured that <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is shorted to ground, so I inject 1.5v there, replaced <CAPACITOR>C7377L</CAPACITOR>, short is gone, but ppbus is still 4v, but not stable, any advice ? idk where to proceed right now,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 4v
threads.message: I have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, I have replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> too

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 4v
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; many times mentioned.

So you've just injected voltage into <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> BEFORE searching for an shorted high-side MOSFET.
I can only hope you'll fry one board and then stop do this; is probably the only way to learn why.
Two many times I explained the reason, I will not repeat again here...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 4v
threads.message:
By high side mosfet do you mean the Qxxx thing? Or do you mean i must remove f7140 to see if the short is on system side / isl? I have remove it an the short is on ppbus..
Resistance between 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is 3 ohm and 21 ohm, for the details i will check tomorrow..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 4v
threads.message: so I found that <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> is shorted, I replaced it and the short is gone, fuse's resistance is more than 1 , so I replaced it too, now I have fan spin, and ppbus is 8.6v, but no chime and no image, resistance to ground on L7130 is 0.5kohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 4v
threads.message: Nvm, board turn on now.. But i still need the answer regarding is mosfet the Q7 bla bla thing? So when searching for shorted mosfet it must be done manually? ( Not by injecting) thanks before for helping 2informaticos!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 4v
threads.message:
"I found that <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> is shorted"
Ton of luck, you didn't fry the CPU injecting into <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

"searching for shorted mosfet it must be done manually?"
If already detect the short, just compare readings from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with all big coils.
You had EXACTLY the same reading on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and L7630; guess what that meant...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 4v
threads.message: yeah because before i found the short, I remove all the caps 1 by 1 and check if the short persist, well it doesnt really take a lot of time, but sometimes, the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>'s caps doesnt resist the heat quite well and burst ( pop sound , and bad smell coming out of it ).., okay at least I learn something from this, thanks a lot for helping!
